name: Folk Tales — #2 Thumbelina
description:
Welcome to my new series on HEN, Folk Tales (from Around The World). There’ll be 12 artworks in total from 6 different continents.

This time, I got inspired by a famous folk tale from Denmark: Thumbelina. The tale was about a thumb-sized girl born of a flower. The original story told that Thumbelina had a long journey before she finally met her Little Prince.

One of the sequences that I love the most is when she was kidnapped by the marriage-minded toad who madly wanted her to marry the ugly toad junior (which she refused). So I tried to recreate the scene by adding modern touch in it. I replaced the toad junior with the iconic pepe and changed the setting from a swamp to a modern bathtub with a falling star took place outside (don't ask me why, I just feel like it).

You should read the whole story as it contains a very good message about staying true, honesty, and kindness. Thumbelina didn't hurt anybody and helped the needy instead. So in the end, she got her prize and lived a happy life.
